pageContext.claim: “Well, first of all, I didn't talk about it. The media did. I didn't talk about that [firing Fed Chair Jerome Powell]. And I would say that I was not happy with him at the beginning, and I'm getting more and more happy with him.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has been perhaps Powell's toughest critic for years, despite having nominated him to lead the Federal Reserve."My only question is, who is our bigger enemy, Jay Powell or Chairman Xi?" Trump tweeted in 2019. The president has mused about demoting Powell from the chairmanship (though he would remain a member of the Federal Reserve board of governors) and conferred with advisers in late 2018 to explore whether Powell could be fired, as The Washington Post reported.
